channel.title: Emacs on Martin Trojer
channel.description: Recent content in Emacs on Martin Trojer

item.title: Software archaeology, hunting bugs in Emacs
item.description: By reading the title of this post, you might think this entry is about using some clever Emacs skills to find bugs in old software. But no, it’s actually about hunting down bugs in Emacs itself (which incidentally happens to be very old software).

item.title: Clojure and Emacs without Cider redux
item.description: It’s been a couple of months since I’ve stopped using Cider for Clojure development in Emacs. I find a simple ‘inferior lisp’ setup faster and more reliable. For a good summary of why one would consider not using Cider, see Luke VanderHart’s excellent summary.

item.title: Clojure and Emacs without Cider
item.description: I’ve been hacking Clojure for many years now, and I’ve been happy to rekindle my love for Emacs. The Clojure/Emacs toolchain has come a long way during this time: swank-clojure, nREPL, nrepl.el, and now Cider. The feature list is ever-growing, and every time you look, there are some new awesome shortcuts that will ‘make your day’.
